result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip D Mayes Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $250.00 including costs to be paid from bail on deposit.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Straight time. Court against electronic monitoring. Defendant to report for sentence on 07/01/15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip D Mayes Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 1
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served, straight time. Court against electronic monitoring. Defendant to report for sentence on 7/1/2015.  

Fine of $250.00 including costs to be paid from bail on deposit. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form, and Sentencing Referral Credit form received and filed.

Defendant Phillip D Mayes in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum, and Jury Instructions/Elements received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Phillip D Mayes in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-22-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Phillip D Mayes in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Phillip D Mayes in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Phillip D Mayes in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. LR  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-15-2015 at 01:30 pm.

03-05-15

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Phillip D Mayes in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Phillip D Mayes in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
